name: Moraes Moreira
description: '''Antônio Carlos Moreira Pires''' (July 8, 1947 – April 13, 2020), better known as '''Moraes Moreira''' {{IPA|pt|moˈɾajz muˈɾejɾa|}}, was a [[Brazilians|Brazilian]] [[musician]] and [[songwriter]]. During the 1970s he played [[Classical guitar|guitar]] and sang in the band [[Novos Baianos]], after which he embarked on a [[Solo (music)|solo]] career recording 29 albums. Moreira was involved in recording 40 full-length albums with Novos Baianos and Trio Elétrico Dodô e Osmar, and two more albums with guitarist [[Pepeu Gomes]]. Moreira was one of the most versatile [[composer]]s of Brazil, mixing the genres of [[Rock music|rock]], [[samba]], ''[[choro]]'', ''[[frevo]]'', ''[[Baião (music)|baião]]'', and [[Classical music|classical]].
